Package displays

Class Player

java.lang.Object
displays.Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class. Created by client by filling out the options from PlayerCreateDisplay. Holds onto various things that the user has picked for themselves as well as external / internal information.
Author:
Jonathan Houge

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, String color, String opponent, String fileName, String time)
      Player Constructor. Takes in everything entered by the client from the PlayerCreateDisplay and sets up the Player object.
      Parameters:
      name - : name entered by client. if it was never changed, we'll give them a default one.
      color - : their chosen color, either black or white. may be changed by the server.
      opponent - : the type of mode they've picked ("Local", "Remote" or "Robot").
      fileName - : optional. if they've chosen to play a previously saved game.
      time - : optional. if they've chosen to play with a time constraint.

  • Method Details

    • setID

      public void setID(int id)
      setting the Player's ID. This is done to make sure the first player joined gets the color they picked.
      Parameters:
      id - : the ID set by the server.

    • setColor

      public void setColor(String color)
      setting the Player's color. If their ID isn't '1', their color will be changed.
      Parameters:
      color - : the color set by the server.

    • setUsername

      public void setUsername(String name)
      setting the Player's username.
      Parameters:
      name - : username to be set.

    • setTime

      public void setTime(String time)
      setting the Player's time.
      Parameters:
      time - : time string.

    • addPoints

      public void addPoints(int points)
      adding to the player's score. currently unimplemented.
      Parameters:
      points - : points added from taken piece.
